value.title: Different ways to work with Microsoft Excel in Power BI
value.excerpt: Adam looks at the different ways you can use Microsoft Excel with Power BI. So many choices!  Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: From Decomposition Tree to Details in Power BI!!!
value.excerpt: The Decomposition Tree is an amazing visual but how can we get to the details. Where's my drill through? Patrick walks you through how you can set this up in Power BI Desktop!  Create and view decomposition tree visuals in Power BI https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-decomposition-tree

value.title: Get creative with buttons in Power BI!
value.excerpt: Want to know how to create a button in Power BI that has an icon along with text? Adam walks you through how to set this up and to have colors sync when interacting with it. value.title: Get started with SPARK in Azure Synapse Analytics
value.excerpt: Using Spark in Azure Synapse Analytics opens up a lot of possibilities to work with your data. Venk joins us to get you started with setting it up and quickly using data. value.title: How do you conditionally highlight a bar in a Power BI Report?

value.title: Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium
value.excerpt: In this video, Christian Wade joined Adam Saxton to discuss Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium. You can use Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium to take your dataset beyond 1GB and avoid failures such as timeouts.  Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium documentation - https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-premium-incremental-refresh

value.title: Native Query: Be careful when using in Power BI

value.title: Power BI Pivot: Move Data from Rows to Columns #Q&A

value.excerpt: If you want to compare the sales up to a particular day and compare it with the previous period (month, quarter, or year) but up to that particular day in that period, then it is called previous month-to-date, previous quarter-to-date, and previous year-to-date. value.title: Power BI Get Data from Google Sheets
value.excerpt: Power BI can get data from Google Sheet now. This functionality is released just yesterday and announced in both Power BI and Power Query blogs. The feature is still preview (Beta) but it is worthwhile looking at how it works in a quick article and video. Study more from my blog article here:  https://radacad.com/power-bi-get-data-from-google-sheets

value.title: Showing Ranking in a Visual in Power BI using RANKX DAX function
value.excerpt: If you want to show the ranking in a Power BI visual, one way is to use a visual that supports that, such as a Ribbon chart. Another way, which is a more common way, is to write a calculation for rank, and RANKX is a DAX function that can help you with that. In this article and video, I explain how that

value.title: What a Power BI Hierarchy Is and How to Use it
value.excerpt: Power BI hierarchies are a useful structure for drill-down and data exploration in reports. A hierarchy can be created simply and can add great value for you as a developer and end-users for better data analysis. In this article and video, I’ll explain what a Power BI hierarchy is and how to create it.
